# Schedule

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Install and load required packages
if (!requireNamespace("dplyr", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("dplyr", quiet = TRUE)
}
if (!requireNamespace("kableExtra", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("kableExtra", quiet = TRUE)
}

# Load libraries with explicit namespace
suppressPackageStartupMessages({
  library(dplyr)
  library(kableExtra)
})

# Read CSV with proper handling
data <- read.csv("sched_basic.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE, check.names = TRUE)

# Check if dplyr is properly loaded
if (!exists("mutate", mode = "function")) {
  library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
}

# Create the table data
table_data <- data %>%
  dplyr::mutate(Time = paste0(time_start, "-", time_end),
                Speaker = ifelse(is.na(Speaker) | Speaker == "", "", Speaker),
                Topic = ifelse(is.na(Topic) | Topic == "", "", Topic),
                Event = event
               ) %>%
  dplyr::select(Time, Event, Speaker, Topic, Title)

# Count rows for each day
day1_count <- sum(data$Day == 1, na.rm = TRUE)
day2_count <- sum(data$Day == 2, na.rm = TRUE)

# Create the table
table_data %>%
  kableExtra::kbl(escape = FALSE, align = "rlcccc", table.attr = 'class="schedule-table"')  %>%
  kable_styling() %>%
  column_spec(1, width = "20%", extra_css = "padding-right: 20px;") %>%
  #column_spec(2, width = "20%", extra_css = "padding-right: 20px;") %>%
 # row_spec(c(4,8,11), background = "lightgrey") %>%
    kableExtra::pack_rows(index = setNames(c(day1_count, day2_count), c("Monday", "Tuesday")),
              label_row_css = "border-bottom: 2px solid #000000;")



```
